text: Hello <@U079ATTQVUG>. So the free version only does Schemas. But we have a version that moves data an unlimited quantity of times called the Portal Toolkit. <https://datawarehouse.io/product/HubSpot-developer-sandbox-portal-migration-toolkit/> It lets you create change sets, make full sandboxes in dev accounts etc. Perhaps it solves more of your needs.
There are more objects in HubSpot Marketing Hub other than pages. I suppose it just depends on what you are trying to test out.
For example you may be using emails.
What email did you get? We use Clarity on our HubSpot hosted page but not through HubSpot. Is that a possiblity now?
<https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/clarity/third-party-integrations/HubSpot-integration>
Thanks!

so, in my testing - the workflow:  
i use my test contact  (me) along with our test dealer, and email token i have used address, city of associated contacts  you can see in preview mode it looks great
BUT in using the test workflow, this is what i get..its missing the dealer address.  i have used/double checked that i am pulling from the dealer token so i am lost as to why its not connecting the 2 together... what am i missing???
<@U079YBL2ELC> - are you sending this from a Contact workflow or a Deal workflow?

The way this works:
In preview, if there are multiple object type tokens detected in the body content, the preview pane lets you pick a test contact and an associated record type (i.e. a deal)

However, those tokens only have known values when sent from the corresponding Workflow type.

This is because of the 1:Many data type between a Contact record and a Deal (if sent from a Contact workflow, which deal should be picked to populate?)

Hi all, So HubSpot support have recommended I come here to ask my question. I wondered if it is possible to change the navigation menu and create a whole brand new section. My idea is that I would like an inventory section where I can view all of my inventory that I have available? Is this possible within HubSpot? As from what I can see I could create an app however this would be associated to a record rather than in its own independent section which is what I would want from a reporting perspective and from a marketing aspect. Theory being if I know what I have available within the inventory I will be able to identify what is best to sell?
You can still technically do this from a Contact Workflow or batch email, but then you need to use programmable email functionality to query the exact deal you want to populate

I have created a custom object- ( Dealer name), i am using the dealer name object token with contacts token in email template ( as contacts & dealer associated with each other) but in preview i am getting value of token but not getting token value while testing with workflows
Are you sending the email from a Dealer workflow?
I am using contact workflows

Hey James, can you give a bit of a rundown on:
1. What are you selling (what is your inventory?)
    a. how many different products do you have? 
    b. how is your inventory controlled and updated? (in another system? what is that system?)
    c. What type of volume do you do?
2. Are you running an inside sales model where you're making a sales-rep led recommendation on a specific product?
3. What HubSpot Hubs and tiers types do you have in your subscription (i.e. are any Hubs Enterprise tier? Do you have Sales Hub Enterprise?)

You should send this from a Dealer based workflow instead, then use the action of "Send email" and it will send to any associated contact, or you can limit based on the association label between the Contact <> Dealer
What's the send trigger for this email? (When and how should this email be sent? i.e. to a contact after they submit an inquiry form?)
Yes, contact after they submit an enquiry form
How are you making the connection between the contact and the specific dealer?
I have to send the email to contact having details of dealer data
When the contact submits the enquiry form, how do you know which dealer record the contact should be associated to?
When contacts submits a form  its have dealer name  value in itâ€™s which is associated with dealer name object by dealer name value with the help of workflows
Do you also have a custom object type that represents the specific inventory (car) that the visitor is interested in? (i.e. Contact <> Car <> Dealer object relationship)?

Hi Robert, Thanks for coming back to me.

So it was an idea which I wondered if it was possible this afternoon as products are a consideration.

â€¢ There would be 5 variants
â€¢ currently monitored via an excel

2. Yes that would be the approach
3. Currently on Sales Pro
The question is more for if we were considering it could it be created in HubSpot or would we need a separate inventory system?
Yes, but we have to send only dealer data to contacts
(gotta run to a meeting, I'll drop back in to this thread later)
Did i try to used dealer based workflows
Is the enquiry form a custom form or a HubSpot embedded form?
third party form

Ok - this is a bit of a tricky scenario since you're dealing with a few different object and data types: (the enquiry, the contact, the dealer, the car)

Can you give an overview of the different components you have (form, do you need to do other back-end processing before submitting to HubSpot? what data is available on the website at time of form submission, what data only lives on a HubSpot object record?)
in dealer custom object we have all data live. now i only test the tokens of dealer association with conatcts by manual enroll
i want to know is dealer name which is associated with the contacts- can i used both token i same email template and use in the workflows

1. In a Contact based workflow the Dealer token values are not directly accessible (which is what you're seeing right now)
2. In a Dealer based workflow both the Dealer and Contact tokens are accessible (which is the way to do this, except I don't think your use case probably supports this option very easily since you likely have Many contacts associated to a dealer over time)
If it's possible for a Contact to become associated to only 1 Dealer at a time, you can relatively easily use programmable email queries (it does take writing some HuBL code)

If a contact can be associated to more than 1 dealer, you will need to be able to sort the Dealers to know which dealer record to pull in (still using programmable email and writing Hubl)

Docs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/content/data-driven-content/emails-with-programmable-content>
the contact is associated with the one dealer nwo
Over time though it's likely that as more enquiries come in, that one dealer has many contacts associated to it?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

â€¢ Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
â€¢ Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
â€¢ Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
â€¢ Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
